question:
You have seen a job advertised in the newspaper. You want to apply for the job.
Write a letter to the manager of the company. In your letter
text: My name is Christian Betre. I am writing this letter to apply for the job advertised in the newspaper. I believe that my educational and working background makes me well qualified for the position.

A little bit about my educational background, I am currently studying to get my MPH in Biostatistics at the University of Maryland and will graduate this upcoming Spring. I have taken courses such as Longitudinal Data Analysis and Epidemiology. Additionally, I am in the process of completing my thesis paper on vaccines' long-term effects on infectious diseases. Lastly, I have taken supplementary courses to better hone  my medical writing skills.

During my studies, I have been working as a Data Operator at a clinical research company. This experience has helped me improve my leadership, communication competence, and ability to work with various departments. While leading and supervising subordinates, I have gained valuable experience that is in line with the job description.
If you need any more information, I have attached my current CV to this letter. You can contact me easily at any time by the email on the attached resume.
Thank you for your consideration of my request. I look forward to hearing from you in the near future.
